analyzed: de nas gzhan yang byi ba'i mig dang / bya rgod kyi mig dang / sa 'og skyong bas kyang cha mnyam por gcig tu byas pa'i ril bu bshang lam du gzhug par bya ste /
translated: Then, one should make a pill of the eye of a rat, the eye of a vulture, and the root of bhūmipaṭola, and insert it into one’s anus.

original: skad cig de las de mi mthong bar 'gro bar byed do //
analyzed: skad cig de las de mi mthong bar 'gro bar byed do //
translated: In that very moment one will become invisible.

original: de nas yang @441b nyi ma'i res la byi ba'i mig rab tu blangs te /
analyzed: de nas yang @441b nyi ma'i res la byi ba'i mig rab tu blangs te /
translated: Then, on a day of the sun, take a cat's eye🔽and mix it with indigo and the root of citraka.

original: rams dang tsi tra ka sngon po'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig bya rgod kyi khag gis btags par bya ste /
analyzed: rams dang tsi tra ka sngon po'i rtsa ba dang lhan cig bya rgod kyi khag gis btags par bya ste /
translated: It should be wrapped in a vulture's wing.

original: mi snang ba'i mchog go /
analyzed: mi snang ba'i mchog go /
translated: This is the best invisibility.

original: de nas gzhan yang p'a sh'i m'an sa dang / ba la m'an sa dang / ba h'um ra pha la bsnyams te dar gos kyis dkris nas bram ze'i thod pa la me lce'i dreg pa 'chags par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang p'a sh'i m'an sa dang / ba la m'an sa dang / ba h'um ra pha la bsnyams te dar gos kyis dkris nas bram ze'i thod pa la me lce'i dreg pa 'chags par bya'o //
translated: Then, furthermore, take pāśīmaṃsa, balāmaṃsa, and baṃharaphala, wrap them in silk, and place them in a Brahmin's skull. The flame of the fire will be extinguished.

original: de'i mig sman gyis mig gnyis la byug na mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i mig sman gyis mig gnyis la byug na mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one anoints one's two eyes with the eye medicine of that, one will become invisible.

original: de nas gzhan yang gdol pa'i me tog dang / sh'a t'a ba dha dang / 'dab bzang gi mig rnams ril bu byas te khar bcug na /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang gdol pa'i me tog dang / sh'a t'a ba dha dang / 'dab bzang gi mig rnams ril bu byas te khar bcug na /
translated: Then, furthermore, make a pill of the flowers of a caṇḍāla, śāṭabandha, and a beautiful eye, and place it in one's mouth.

original: de mis mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de mis mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will become invisible to humans.

original: de nas gzhan yang 'dab bzang blangs la nyi ma bdun gyi bar du dngul chu ma sh'a gcig byas te bza' bar bya 'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang 'dab bzang blangs la nyi ma bdun gyi bar du dngul chu ma sh'a gcig byas te bza' bar bya 'o //
translated: Then, furthermore, take a beautiful eye, and for seven days, make a single mercury pill and eat it.🔽 One will become invisible to humans.

original: des brun du gyur ba gang yin pa de dang lhan cig bdag nyid kyi khu bas thig le byas na /
analyzed: des brun du gyur ba gang yin pa de dang lhan cig bdag nyid kyi khu bas thig le byas na /
translated: If one mixes that with one’s own semen,

original: mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mi mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will become invisible.

original: 'di ni / mi snang ba'i rab tu bya ba 'o //
analyzed: 'di ni / mi snang ba'i rab tu bya ba 'o //
translated: This is the rite of invisibility.

original: mig sman bshad bar bya ste /
analyzed: mig sman bshad bar bya ste /
translated: The eye ointment will now be explained.

original: thog mar re zhig mig sman gyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags 'bum phrag lnga yongs su bzlas te mig sman sgrub pa brtsam par bya 'o //
analyzed: thog mar re zhig mig sman gyi don du bcom ldan 'das kyi sngags 'bum phrag lnga yongs su bzlas te mig sman sgrub pa brtsam par bya 'o //
translated: First, for the sake of the eye ointment, one should recite the Blessed One’s mantra five hundred thousand times and then begin the practice of the eye ointment.

original: dung dang bya rgod dang ku ra ra rnams kyi mig blangs te ma nyams nas sa 'og gi sbrang rtsi'i khu ba la dar gos kyi sdong bus dreg pa 'chags par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dung dang bya rgod dang ku ra ra rnams kyi mig blangs te ma nyams nas sa 'og gi sbrang rtsi'i khu ba la dar gos kyi sdong bus dreg pa 'chags par 'gyur ro //
translated: One should take the eyes of a conch, a vulture, and a curlew, and without damaging them, one should grind them with the juice of underground turmeric on a cloth-covered grindstone.

original: gang gis 'di'i mig sman byugs ba tsam gyis sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gis 'di'i mig sman byugs ba tsam gyis sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Whoever applies this eye ointment will be able to see underground.

original: skar ma lag la bri ha ti dkar po'i rtsa ba dang / @442a *//
analyzed: skar ma lag la bri ha ti dkar po'i rtsa ba dang / @442a *//
translated: One should take the root of white bṛhatī under the constellation Puṣya,

original: dza yant'i nag po'i rtsa ba dang / lce spyang gi mig bsnyams te sbrang rtsis lhan cig btags nas thig le byas na /
analyzed: dza yant'i nag po'i rtsa ba dang / lce spyang gi mig bsnyams te sbrang rtsis lhan cig btags nas thig le byas na /
translated: Mix together the root of black jayantī, the eye of a jackal, and honey, and make a bindu.

original: sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will see the holes in the earth.

original: bh'u mi la ta'i til mar dang / bi sham ka ra'i rtsa ba'i khu bar dza dang bcas pas /
analyzed: bh'u mi la ta'i til mar dang / bi sham ka ra'i rtsa ba'i khu bar dza dang bcas pas /
translated: Mix together sesame oil, the juice of the root of viśva, and curd.

original: dar gos la gzhon nu mas byas pa'i srad bus dkris nas sdong bu byas te mi'i thod pa la dreg pa 'chags par byas la mig sman byas na /
analyzed: dar gos la gzhon nu mas byas pa'i srad bus dkris nas sdong bu byas te mi'i thod pa la dreg pa 'chags par byas la mig sman byas na /
translated: Wrap it with a thread made by a young girl in silk, make it into a wick, and put it in a human skull.

original: nges par gter mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: nges par gter mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: One will definitely see treasure.

original: de nas gzhan yang rgyal gyi zla ba dang / skar ma snubs la zla mtshan gyi gos blangs te brgyad pa'am bcu bzhi pa la rdo rje tsa rtsi ka'i thang sku mngon par bris la mchod pa chen po byas na /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang rgyal gyi zla ba dang / skar ma snubs la zla mtshan gyi gos blangs te brgyad pa'am bcu bzhi pa la rdo rje tsa rtsi ka'i thang sku mngon par bris la mchod pa chen po byas na /
translated: Furthermore, on the night of the full moon or the new moon, take menstrual cloth, and on the eighth or the fourteenth, draw a painting of Vajra Cārava, and make a great offering.

original: mtshan mo 'bum phrag gcig bzlas na nges par rmi lam gyi gter mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshan mo 'bum phrag gcig bzlas na nges par rmi lam gyi gter mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one recites one hundred thousand times at night, one will definitely see treasure in a dream.

original: de nas gzhan yang shing ni ma pa'i rtser song ste brgyad pa'am bcu bzhi pa la thang sku'i mdun du tsartsi ka bsams nas lce spyang gi mgo'i steng du khri phrag bzlas na /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang shing ni ma pa'i rtser song ste brgyad pa'am bcu bzhi pa la thang sku'i mdun du tsartsi ka bsams nas lce spyang gi mgo'i steng du khri phrag bzlas na /
translated: Then, furthermore, having gone to the top of a mango tree, one should visualize Cārucīrikā in front of the painting on the eighth or the fourteenth day, and repeat [her mantra] ten thousand times on top of the head of a jackal.🔽Cārucīrikā will come into [the practitioner's] presence and ask, What should I do? The practitioner should say, Grant me the accomplishment of eye medicine.

original: tsartsi ka drung du 'ongs nas bdag gis ci bya 'dri bar 'gyur zhing sgrub pa pos bdag la mig sman gyi grub pa rab tu stsol ces pa dang / bdag la ro'i bcud len stsol ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: tsartsi ka drung du 'ongs nas bdag gis ci bya 'dri bar 'gyur zhing sgrub pa pos bdag la mig sman gyi grub pa rab tu stsol ces pa dang / bdag la ro'i bcud len stsol ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: Grant me the elixir of the dead.

original: gi wang dang lce spyang gi mig dang / dngul chu dang / shing ta la'i khu ba dang / sbrang rtsi mnyam pa rnams mkhas pas ril bu bya'o //
analyzed: gi wang dang lce spyang gi mig dang / dngul chu dang / shing ta la'i khu ba dang / sbrang rtsi mnyam pa rnams mkhas pas ril bu bya'o //
translated: The wise one should make a pill of equal parts of realgar, jackal's eye, mercury, date juice, and honey.

original: 'dis mig sman byas pa'i mig ni /
analyzed: 'dis mig sman byas pa'i mig ni /
translated: Having made eye medicine with this,

original: sa'i bu ga @442b mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i bu ga @442b mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will see the openings of the earth.

original: lce spyang gi mig dang / bya rgod kyi mig dang / ku ra ra'i mig rnams de kho na ltar g-yon pas g-yon pa dang / g-yas pas g-yas pa bzung ste til mar chen pos dreg pa 'chags par bya 'o //
analyzed: lce spyang gi mig dang / bya rgod kyi mig dang / ku ra ra'i mig rnams de kho na ltar g-yon pas g-yon pa dang / g-yas pas g-yas pa bzung ste til mar chen pos dreg pa 'chags par bya 'o //
translated: The eyes of a jackal, a vulture, and a crow, held in the left hand on the left side and in the right hand on the right side, respectively, should be rubbed with great sesame oil.

original: 'dis mig sman byas pa'i mig ni /
analyzed: 'dis mig sman byas pa'i mig ni /
translated: When this is used as an eye ointment,

original: sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: one will see the holes in the ground.

original: de nas gzhan yang gi wang dang / mi'i mkhris pa dang / ga bur dang / dngul dang / de bzhin du ha ram byin nas brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang gi wang dang / mi'i mkhris pa dang / ga bur dang / dngul dang / de bzhin du ha ram byin nas brtag par bya'o //
translated: “Next, one should prepare a collyrium from realgar, human bile, camphor, silver, and harītaki.

original: 'dis mig sman byas na sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dis mig sman byas na sa'i bu ga mthong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When this is used as an eye ointment, one will see the holes in the ground.

original: de nas gzhan yang /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang /
translated: “Next,

original: grub pa sna tshogs gnas kyi don //
analyzed: grub pa sna tshogs gnas kyi don //
translated: the various accomplishments,

original: nor dang 'bru sogs phun sum tshogs //
analyzed: nor dang 'bru sogs phun sum tshogs //
translated: wealth, grains, and so forth,

original: lcags brgyad 'joms shing nam mkha' la //
analyzed: lcags brgyad 'joms shing nam mkha' la //
translated: the destruction of the eight metals,🔽and the ability to fly

original: spyod pa nyid kyang ster bar 'gyur //
analyzed: spyod pa nyid kyang ster bar 'gyur //
translated: will be granted.

original: sngon du bsnyen pa'i don du sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas nas dngul chu'i sgrub thabs brtsam par bya 'o //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen pa'i don du sngags 'bum phrag gcig bzlas nas dngul chu'i sgrub thabs brtsam par bya 'o //
translated: Having recited the mantra one hundred thousand times for the sake of preliminary practice, one should undertake the practice of mercury.

original: thog mar dngul chu blangs te tsi tra ka dmar po'i khu bas bsnur bar bya 'o //
analyzed: thog mar dngul chu blangs te tsi tra ka dmar po'i khu bas bsnur bar bya 'o //
translated: First, one should take mercury and smear it with the juice of red lac.

original: de'i rjes la zangs kyi khu ba dang / gser gyi phye ma byin nas sh'a kho da'i khu bas bzhi cha tshad kyi nor bu bya 'o //
analyzed: de'i rjes la zangs kyi khu ba dang / gser gyi phye ma byin nas sh'a kho da'i khu bas bzhi cha tshad kyi nor bu bya 'o //
translated: After that, one should add copper juice and gold powder, and with the juice of śākoṭa one should make a pill the size of a śākoṭa fruit.

original: glang po che'i sha dang / ldong ros kyis mnyam por btags te kong bu kha sbyar gyi nang du ra dza byin nas bsro bar bya 'o //
analyzed: glang po che'i sha dang / ldong ros kyis mnyam por btags te kong bu kha sbyar gyi nang du ra dza byin nas bsro bar bya 'o //
translated: One should mix elephant meat and red arsenic, and having placed it in a double pot, one should heat it with a fire of horse dung.

original: gong bu gyur pa phyed mar byas nas ra ti'i tshad kyis zangs 'joms shing gser dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gong bu gyur pa phyed mar byas nas ra ti'i tshad kyis zangs 'joms shing gser dang mtshungs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having made it into a lump, one should cut it in half, and with the measure of a ratī, one will destroy copper and it will become like gold.

original: ro 'di dag til mar chen pos bsnur nas lhang tsher dang / mu zis til mar chen po nyi ma gsum btso bar bya @443a *//
analyzed: ro 'di dag til mar chen pos bsnur nas lhang tsher dang / mu zis til mar chen po nyi ma gsum btso bar bya @443a *//
translated: Having smeared these corpses with sesame oil, one should boil them for three days with mustard oil and black salt,

original: ste; ji srid slar gong bur gyur gyi bar du 'o //
analyzed: ste; ji srid slar gong bur gyur gyi bar du 'o //
translated: until they become lumps again.

original: sbrang rtsi dang lhan cig cung zad zos pa la skyes bu lo stong phrag tu 'tsho bar 'gyur la /
analyzed: sbrang rtsi dang lhan cig cung zad zos pa la skyes bu lo stong phrag tu 'tsho bar 'gyur la /
translated: One who eats a little with honey will live for thousands of years.

original: dngul bcos nas gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dngul bcos nas gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: Silver becomes gold.

original: gzhan yang b'a hl'a ba'i khu ba byin nas dngul chu bsnur bar bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang b'a hl'a ba'i khu ba byin nas dngul chu bsnur bar bya ste /
translated: Moreover, having given the juice of bahala, silver is melted.

original: ji srid gong bur gyur gyi bar du 'o //
analyzed: ji srid gong bur gyur gyi bar du 'o //
translated: As long as it becomes a lump.

original: sha t'a la dang dzambhi ra'i khu ba dang / sh'a kho da ka'i 'bras bu'i shun pa so sor mnyam por byin nas kong bu'i nang du bzhag ste /
analyzed: sha t'a la dang dzambhi ra'i khu ba dang / sh'a kho da ka'i 'bras bu'i shun pa so sor mnyam por byin nas kong bu'i nang du bzhag ste /
translated: Having given the juice of shatala and jambhira and the outer skin of shakodaka fruit, it is placed in a pot.

original: de nyid kyis rab tu byug par bya zhing bskams la phyi nas kong bur bsreg par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyis rab tu byug par bya zhing bskams la phyi nas kong bur bsreg par bya ste /
translated: It is anointed with that very thing, dried, and then burned in a pot.

original: myur du gong bu'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: myur du gong bu'i tshad du 'gyur ro //
translated: It quickly becomes the size of a lump.

original: ra ti gnyis kyi tshad kyi nyi ma nyi shu rtsa gcig ji srid par lo ma dang skyur po spangs shing thams cad du bud med bsten pa yang spang bar bya ste /
analyzed: ra ti gnyis kyi tshad kyi nyi ma nyi shu rtsa gcig ji srid par lo ma dang skyur po spangs shing thams cad du bud med bsten pa yang spang bar bya ste /
translated: For twenty-one days the size of two ratis, as long as one avoids leaves and sour things and completely gives up relying on women,

original: skyes bu lo stong phrag bcu gnyis su 'tsho zhing /
analyzed: skyes bu lo stong phrag bcu gnyis su 'tsho zhing /
translated: a man lives for twelve thousand years.

original: mkha' la spyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mkha' la spyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will obtain the state of flying in the sky.

original: bam ga bcom na sa dngul chur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bam ga bcom na sa dngul chur 'gyur ro //
translated: When the mercury is destroyed, it becomes silver.

original: de nas gzhan yang ran dz'a ni la'i khu bas /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang ran dz'a ni la'i khu bas /
translated: Then, furthermore, with the juice of ranjanī,

original: su pa ra na m'akshi dang / pashte sa ra ta'i rtsa ba mnye bar bya ste /
analyzed: su pa ra na m'akshi dang / pashte sa ra ta'i rtsa ba mnye bar bya ste /
translated: one should anoint the root of suvarṇākṣī and paṭhīnasāra.

original: lhang tsher dang / na ra do ni'i khu bas god bur bya 'o //
analyzed: lhang tsher dang / na ra do ni'i khu bas god bur bya 'o //
translated: One should anoint with the juice of lāṅgalī and naradī.

original: kong bu'i nang du bzhag nas pha ri'i til mar la sbyar bar bya ste /
analyzed: kong bu'i nang du bzhag nas pha ri'i til mar la sbyar bar bya ste /
translated: Having placed it in a pot, one should mix it with sesame oil.

original: zla ba drug gis gong bur 'gyur na lcags brgyad rnams nges par gser du 'gyur la /
analyzed: zla ba drug gis gong bur 'gyur na lcags brgyad rnams nges par gser du 'gyur la /
translated: If it becomes a ball in six months, the eight metals will certainly become gold.

original: zos pas mkha' la sbyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zos pas mkha' la sbyod pa nyid thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: By eating it, one will obtain the state of flying in the sky.

original: mthong ba dang reg pa tsam gyis lo lnga brgya rnams su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mthong ba dang reg pa tsam gyis lo lnga brgya rnams su 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: By merely seeing and touching it, one will live for five hundred years.

original: @443b de nas gzhan yang dngul chu ku ma ri'i khu bas bsnur bar bya ste /
analyzed: @443b de nas gzhan yang dngul chu ku ma ri'i khu bas bsnur bar bya ste /
translated: Then, furthermore, one should anoint with the juice of mercury kumārī.

original: so ma ha dang / ba l'a sha'i rtsa ba dang / n'a ga ke sha ra'i shun pa dang / btsag dang / ka thi n'i dang / de bzhin du slar ba da'i 'o ma dang mnyam pos bsro bar bya ste /
analyzed: so ma ha dang / ba l'a sha'i rtsa ba dang / n'a ga ke sha ra'i shun pa dang / btsag dang / ka thi n'i dang / de bzhin du slar ba da'i 'o ma dang mnyam pos bsro bar bya ste /
translated: and likewise, again, with the same amount of goat's milk, it should be heated.

original: thun gnyis kyis gong bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thun gnyis kyis gong bur 'gyur ro //
translated: In two watches it becomes a lump.

original: cung zad zos pa tsam gyis nges par sa gsum du 'gro bar byed cing /
analyzed: cung zad zos pa tsam gyis nges par sa gsum du 'gro bar byed cing /
translated: By merely eating a little of it, one will certainly go to the three realms.

original: ra ti tsam gyis nges par zangs srang gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ra ti tsam gyis nges par zangs srang gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: By just one ratti, copper will certainly become gold.

original: de nas gzhan yang dngul chu shr'i khanda'i so dzu'i 'o mas cung zad mnyes te mu zi dang zangs kyi snod du dzambhi ra'i khu bas mnye zhing nyi 'od la bskam par bya 'o //
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang dngul chu shr'i khanda'i so dzu'i 'o mas cung zad mnyes te mu zi dang zangs kyi snod du dzambhi ra'i khu bas mnye zhing nyi 'od la bskam par bya 'o //
translated: Then, again, the mercury should be slightly moistened with the milk of a she-goat, and in a lead or copper vessel, it should be moistened with the juice of jambhira and dried in the sun.

original: gong bur gyur pa kong bu'i nang du bzhag ste thun gnyis su bsro bar bya 'o //
analyzed: gong bur gyur pa kong bu'i nang du bzhag ste thun gnyis su bsro bar bya 'o //
translated: Having become a lump, it should be placed in a pot and heated in two watches.

original: su ki ti'i kong bur bcug la ra ti'i tshad kyis dbug par bya ste zangs bcom nas gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: su ki ti'i kong bur bcug la ra ti'i tshad kyis dbug par bya ste zangs bcom nas gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: Having placed it in a pot of sukit, it should be pierced with a ratti measure. Having destroyed the copper, it becomes gold.

original: lus kyi yang mnyer ma dang skra dkar spong zhing phan par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus kyi yang mnyer ma dang skra dkar spong zhing phan par 'gyur ro //
translated: It will remove wrinkles and gray hair and will be beneficial.

original: de nas gzhan yang dngul chu ba la'i rtsa bar bsnur bar bya zhing /
analyzed: de nas gzhan yang dngul chu ba la'i rtsa bar bsnur bar bya zhing /
translated: Then, again, it should be heated in the root of silverweed.

original: slar yang gdol pa'i me tog gi khu bas bsnur bar bya 'o //
analyzed: slar yang gdol pa'i me tog gi khu bas bsnur bar bya 'o //
translated: Again, it should be heated in the juice of the flower of the outcaste.

original: slar yang skan tsa ka dang / ba ha ri'i khu ba la bsnur bar bya' o //
analyzed: slar yang skan tsa ka dang / ba ha ri'i khu ba la bsnur bar bya' o //
translated: Again, it should be heated in the juice of the kantaka and the bahuri.

original: de'i la ra ti'i tshad kyi gser gyi phye ma byin nas gong bur bya 'o //
analyzed: de'i la ra ti'i tshad kyi gser gyi phye ma byin nas gong bur bya 'o //
translated: One part of it should be given to one part of gold dust of the measure of a ratti and made into a pill.

original: 'dab ma bdun pa'i kong bu'i nang du kun dz'a ra'i rkang pa'i tshad kyis dum bu byin na gong bur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dab ma bdun pa'i kong bu'i nang du kun dz'a ra'i rkang pa'i tshad kyis dum bu byin na gong bur 'gyur ro //
translated: In a seven-petaled flower cup, one part of it should be given to one part of copper of the measure of a karsa and made into a pill.

original: de blangs te ra ti'i tshad kyis zangs 'joms shing gser du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de blangs te ra ti'i tshad kyis zangs 'joms shing gser du 'gyur ro //
translated: Taking that, it will destroy one ratti of copper and become gold.

original: lus la'ang ra ti'i tshad kyis skyon gsum 'phrog par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lus la'ang ra ti'i tshad kyis skyon gsum 'phrog par 'gyur ro //

original: gal te 'ongs par ma gyur na skad cig de la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te 'ongs par ma gyur na skad cig de la 'chi bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'ongs nas kyang bdag gis ci bya zhes bka' stsal du gsol /
analyzed: 'ongs nas kyang bdag gis ci bya zhes bka' stsal du gsol /

analyzed: sgrub pa pos bdag gi bran du mdzod ces smra bar bya'o //

analyzed: lha mo ri bong can blangs te ster bar byed cing rgyab tu khur te lha'i 'jig rten du 'gro ba dang / brgya byin nyid ster bar byed do //
translated: He will take the goddess Candra and give her to the adept, and he will carry him on his back to the divine world and grant Śakrahood.

original: bskal pa bdun du 'tsho ba byed par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bskal pa bdun du 'tsho ba byed par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for seven eons.

original: de nas mi thub pa'i sgrub thabs 'di yin te /
analyzed: de nas mi thub pa'i sgrub thabs 'di yin te /

original: mtshan mo mchod rten gyi mdun du 'dug ste zhag bdun du stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo mchod rten gyi mdun du 'dug ste zhag bdun du stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: At night, in front of a stūpa, one should sit and recite the mantra eight thousand times for seven days.

original: zhag brgyad pa la mchod pa chen po byas nas gtor ma phul te gu gul gyi dud ba dbul zhing bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhag brgyad pa la mchod pa chen po byas nas gtor ma phul te gu gul gyi dud ba dbul zhing bzla bar bya'o //

original: bzlas pa na nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bzlas pa na nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When he is recited, he will certainly come.🔽“O practitioner, what should I do?”

original: kye sgrub pa po bdag gis ci bya zhes so; ;sgrub pa po bdag gis ci bya ba khyod mkhyen no //🔽zhes smra bar bya'o //
analyzed: kye sgrub pa po bdag gis ci bya zhes so; ;sgrub pa po bdag gis ci bya ba khyod mkhyen no // zhes smra bar bya'o //
translated: “You know what I should do.”

original: de nas brtsams nas ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //
analyzed: de nas brtsams nas ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //
translated: Then, starting from then, he will do whatever work is to be done.

original: slar yang rgyal srid ster ro //
analyzed: slar yang rgyal srid ster ro //
translated: He will again grant a kingdom.

original: lo stong phrag tu 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag tu 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for a thousand years.

original: ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //
analyzed: ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //
translated: For as long as he lives, he will do whatever work is to be done.

original: che ge 'tsho bar gyis shig /
analyzed: che ge 'tsho bar gyis shig /
translated: “Live so-and-so long!”

original: ces pa dang / che ge 'chi bar gyis shig ces pa thams cad byed do //
analyzed: ces pa dang / che ge 'chi bar gyis shig ces pa thams cad byed do //
translated: “Die so-and-so long!”—he will do all of this.

original: de nas gsang ba'i sgrub thabs yin te; rdo rje 'dzin pa khang par song ste nyi ma bdun du stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas gsang ba'i sgrub thabs yin te; rdo rje 'dzin pa khang par song ste nyi ma bdun du stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, the secret practice is: having gone to the house of the vajra-holder, one should recite [the mantra] eight thousand times for seven days.

original: nyi ma brgyad pa la mchod pa chen po byas nas zan zho dkar po ji ltar gsungs pa dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma brgyad pa la mchod pa chen po byas nas zan zho dkar po ji ltar gsungs pa dbul bar bya'o //
translated: On the eighth day, having made a great offering, one should offer the white milk porridge as taught.

original: mtshan phyed pa ji srid pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan phyed pa ji srid pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite until midnight.

original: ji srid mtshan phyed pa de nas rang nyid 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji srid mtshan phyed pa de nas rang nyid 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, when midnight has passed, he will come by himself.

analyzed: me tog gi mchod yon dbul bar bya ste / mnyes par gyur na rgyal srid ster zhing bsam pa thams @447a *//

original: cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
analyzed: cad yongs su rdzogs par byed do //
translated: If he is pleased, he will grant a kingdom and fulfill all wishes.

original: de nas kun tu gsang ba'i sgrub thabs yin te /
analyzed: de nas kun tu gsang ba'i sgrub thabs yin te /
translated: Then there is the practice of the complete secret.

original: gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi drung du khri phrag bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: gdung dang bcas pa'i mchod rten gyi drung du khri phrag bzla bar bya ste /
translated: In front of a caitya with a relic, one should recite ten thousand times;

original: sngon du bsnyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: this is the preliminary practice.

original: de nas zla ba nya ba la ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas mtshan phyed pa ji srid pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas zla ba nya ba la ji ltar 'byor pa'i mchod pa byas nas mtshan phyed pa ji srid pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, on the full moon, one should make offerings as much as one can afford, and recite until midnight.

original: de nas mtshan phyed na myur du 'ongs shing mdun du gnas te /🔽kye mnyes gshin ci byed ces smra bar byed do //
analyzed: de nas mtshan phyed na myur du 'ongs shing mdun du gnas te / kye mnyes gshin ci byed ces smra bar byed do //
translated: Then, at midnight, he will quickly come and stand in front.🔽He will say, “O benefactor, what shall I do?”

original: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should say, “You know what I should do.”

original: de nas brtsams te ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //
translated: Then, one should do whatever needs to be done.

original: gnod sbyin gyi bu mo mchog bkug nas ster bar byed do //
analyzed: gnod sbyin gyi bu mo mchog bkug nas ster bar byed do //
translated: One should summon the best of the yakṣiṇīs and give her to one’s son.

original: 'dod ldan gyi mchog ston mo ster bar byed do //
analyzed: 'dod ldan gyi mchog ston mo ster bar byed do //
translated: One should give a feast to the best of those who desire it.

original: nyi ma so sor bza' ba dang / gos zung dang / d'i n'a ra lnga rnams rab tu ster ro //
analyzed: nyi ma so sor bza' ba dang / gos zung dang / d'i n'a ra lnga rnams rab tu ster ro //
translated: One should give food, a pair of garments, and five dinars every day.

original: lo lnga brgya rnams 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: lo lnga brgya rnams 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: One will live for five hundred years.

original: de nas dur khrod bdag po'i sgrub thabs yin te /
analyzed: de nas dur khrod bdag po'i sgrub thabs yin te /
translated: Next, the sādhana of the lord of the charnel ground.

original: mtshan mo dur khrod du song nas nyi ma bdun du stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo dur khrod du song nas nyi ma bdun du stong phrag brgyad bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should go to the charnel ground at night and recite the mantra eight thousand times for seven days.

original: nyi ma brgyad pa la nya dang / sha dang / til dang / dzambu li ka dang / zan dkar po dang / zho dang / bu ram dang / bdug pa dang / 'bras bu ji ltar gsungs pa'i nyi bar mkho ba rnams kyi gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma brgyad pa la nya dang / sha dang / til dang / dzambu li ka dang / zan dkar po dang / zho dang / bu ram dang / bdug pa dang / 'bras bu ji ltar gsungs pa'i nyi bar mkho ba rnams kyi gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //
translated: On the eighth day, one should offer a bali of fish, meat, sesame, jambū leaves, white rice, curd, molasses, incense, and fruits as required, as described.

original: gu gul gyi bdug pa dbul par bya'o //
analyzed: gu gul gyi bdug pa dbul par bya'o //
translated: One should offer bdellium incense.

original: mtshan phyed pa de ji srid pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: mtshan phyed pa de ji srid pa de srid du bzla bar bya'o //
translated: One should recite until midnight.

original: de nas mtshan phyed nas ha ha'i sgra thos par byed do //
analyzed: de nas mtshan phyed nas ha ha'i sgra thos par byed do //
translated: Then, after midnight, one will hear the sound of “ha ha.”

original: de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be afraid of that.

analyzed: 'khor dang bcas pa tshogs kyis yongs su @447b bskor nas 'ong bar 'gyur ro //

original: 'ongs pa na mchod pa dbul zhing mnyes par gyur na /
analyzed: 'ongs pa na mchod pa dbul zhing mnyes par gyur na /
translated: When he comes, one should make offerings and please him.

original: 'byung po thams cad bran du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'byung po thams cad bran du 'gyur ro //
translated: All the bhūtas will become his servants.

original: nyi ma nyi mar d'i n'a ra brgyad rnams rab tu ster bar byed do //
analyzed: nyi ma nyi mar d'i n'a ra brgyad rnams rab tu ster bar byed do //
translated: He will give eight dīnāras every day.

original: dgra thams cad 'joms par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dgra thams cad 'joms par 'gyur ro //
translated: He will destroy all enemies.

original: lo stong phrag 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lo stong phrag 'tsho bar 'gyur ro //
translated: He will live for a thousand years.

original: de nas rigs kyi dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs yin te /
analyzed: de nas rigs kyi dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs yin te /
translated: Next, the sādhana of the lord of the family:🔽One should go to a divine place, offer red flowers with scent, and offer agalloch incense.

original: lha'i gnas su song ste dri dang ldan pa'i me tog dmar po dang / gu gul gyi bdug pa byin nas khri phrag bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: lha'i gnas su song ste dri dang ldan pa'i me tog dmar po dang / gu gul gyi bdug pa byin nas khri phrag bzla bar bya ste /
translated: One should recite ten thousand times.

original: sngon du bsnyen par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: sngon du bsnyen par 'gyur ro //
translated: One will have accomplished the preliminary practice.

original: nag po'i phyogs la mtshan mor nya dang / sha dang / til dang / dzambu li ka dang / bza' ba dmar po'i cho ga gtor ma bzhin dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: nag po'i phyogs la mtshan mor nya dang / sha dang / til dang / dzambu li ka dang / bza' ba dmar po'i cho ga gtor ma bzhin dbul bar bya'o //

analyzed: tu ru ka'i bdug pa byin nas ji srid mtshan byed kyi bar du bzla bar bya'o //

analyzed: de nas 'bar ba chen po zab cing 'jigs pa'i gzugs kyis 'ong bar 'gyur te /
translated: Then, in a terrifying form, he will come with a great blaze.

original: de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de la 'jigs par mi bya'o //
translated: One should not be afraid of him.

original: mnyes gshin ci byed ces smra bar byed do //
analyzed: mnyes gshin ci byed ces smra bar byed do //
translated: He will say, “What service can I perform for you?”

original: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should say, “I know what you have to do.”🔽Then, for as long as one lives, he will do whatever work is to be done.

analyzed: de nas ji srid 'tsho ba'i bar du ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do; ;nyi ma nyi mar thun gsum du d'i n'a ra lnga ster ro //
translated: Day after day, he will give five dinars in the three periods of the day.

original: 'dod pa'i lha rdzas kyi ston mo ster ro //
analyzed: 'dod pa'i lha rdzas kyi ston mo ster ro //
translated: He will give a feast of desired divine substances.

original: lo lnga brgya 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: lo lnga brgya 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: He will cause one to live for five hundred years.

original: de nas 'byung po'i dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs yin te /
analyzed: de nas 'byung po'i dbang phyug gi sgrub thabs yin te /
translated: Next, the sādhana of the lord of bhūtas is as follows.

original: mtshan ma gcig par song ste gcig pus zhag gsum du mtshan mor bza' ba kha zas dmar po dang / nya sha dang / til dang / dzambu li ka'i gtor ma dbul bar bya'o //

original: nyi ma gsum pa la rang nyid @448a *//
analyzed: nyi ma gsum pa la rang nyid @448a *//

original: myur du 'ong zhing mdun du gnas so //
analyzed: myur du 'ong zhing mdun du gnas so //
translated: and stand in front of him.

original: de 'di ltar bdag gis ci bya zhes smra'o //
analyzed: de 'di ltar bdag gis ci bya zhes smra'o //
translated: She will say, “What should I do for you?”

original: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should say, “I know what should be done.”

original: rtag tu rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: rtag tu rjes su 'brang bar 'gyur te /
translated: She will always follow him.

original: nges par lha mo blangs nas ster bar byed do //
analyzed: nges par lha mo blangs nas ster bar byed do //
translated: Having definitely accepted the goddess, she will give him whatever he wants.

original: rang nyid kyis bza' ba dang gos blangs te rnam pa ster bar byed do //
analyzed: rang nyid kyis bza' ba dang gos blangs te rnam pa ster bar byed do //
translated: She will give him food and clothing, and whatever form he desires.

original: lo stong phrag gnyis rnams 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: lo stong phrag gnyis rnams 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: He will live for two thousand years.

original: de nas pho nya mchog gi sgrub thabs yin te /
analyzed: de nas pho nya mchog gi sgrub thabs yin te /
translated: Next is the sādhana of the supreme messenger.

original: rdo rje 'dzin pa khang par song nas nag po'i bcu bzhi la bzlas pa khri bya'o //
analyzed: rdo rje 'dzin pa khang par song nas nag po'i bcu bzhi la bzlas pa khri bya'o //
translated: Having gone to a house where there is a vajra-holder, one should recite ten thousand times on the fourteenth of the dark fortnight.

original: nyi ma bdun rnams su sngon du bsnyen pa bya'o //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun rnams su sngon du bsnyen pa bya'o //
translated: One should perform the preliminary practice for seven days.

original: de nas sgrub thabs brtsam par bya ste /
analyzed: de nas sgrub thabs brtsam par bya ste /
translated: Then one should undertake the ritual.

original: tsandan gyi mandal  byas nas gu gul gyi bdug pa byin la /
analyzed: tsandan gyi mandal  byas nas gu gul gyi bdug pa byin la /
translated: Having prepared a maṇḍala of sandalwood, one should offer an incense of agalloch.

original: zho dang mar dkar po sbyar ba'i zas dang / ku sha'i chun po la nye bar 'dug pas mar gyi mar me rab tu sbar te mtshan mor ji srid mtshan phyed gyur pa de srid bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: zho dang mar dkar po sbyar ba'i zas dang / ku sha'i chun po la nye bar 'dug pas mar gyi mar me rab tu sbar te mtshan mor ji srid mtshan phyed gyur pa de srid bzla bar bya ste /
translated: Sitting on a bundle of kuśa grass, one should recite the mantra for as long as midnight, with food mixed with curd and white mustard oil, and with a lamp of ghee burning.

original: rang nyid pho nya mchog tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rang nyid pho nya mchog tu 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: She will come as the supreme messenger.

original: 'ongs pa na tsandan gyi chus mchod yon sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: 'ongs pa na tsandan gyi chus mchod yon sbyin par bya'o //
translated: When she arrives, one should offer her a welcome offering of sandalwood water.

original: mnyes par gyur na bdag gis ci bya zhes dri'o //
analyzed: mnyes par gyur na bdag gis ci bya zhes dri'o //
translated: When she is pleased, one should ask, “What can I do for you?”

original: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: sgrub pa pos bdag gis ci bya ba khyed mkhyen ces brjod par bya'o //
translated: The practitioner should say, “You know what I should do.”

original: de nas brtsams te ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do //🔽'dod pa'i 'bras bu thams cad rab tu ster ro //
analyzed: de nas brtsams te ci bya ba'i las rnams byed do // 'dod pa'i 'bras bu thams cad rab tu ster ro //

original: yid la 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed do //
analyzed: yid la 'dod pa phun sum tshogs par byed do //
translated: She will fulfill all one’s wishes.

original: de nas 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma sgrub pa ni /
analyzed: de nas 'dod pa'i dbang phyug ma sgrub pa ni /
translated: Next, the accomplishment of the mistress of desire.

analyzed: gro ga'i 'dab ma la gi wang gi gzugs brnyan bris te @448b gcig pu stan la 'dug nas bzlas pa stong phrag bya'o //

original: de nas bzlas pa'i mthar mchod pa chen po byas nas mar gyi sgron me rab tu sbar te mi smra bar bzla bar bya'o //
analyzed: de nas bzlas pa'i mthar mchod pa chen po byas nas mar gyi sgron me rab tu sbar te mi smra bar bzla bar bya'o //
translated: Then, at the end of the recitation, one should make a great offering, light a lamp of ghee, and recite without speaking.

original: de nas mtshan phyed nas nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de nas mtshan phyed nas nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Then, at midnight, she will certainly come.

original: 'ongs pa na 'dod pa byas te chung mar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'ongs pa na 'dod pa byas te chung mar 'gyur ro //
translated: When she comes, one should have intercourse with her, and she will become one’s wife.

analyzed: lha rdzas kyi rgyan dang bza' ba la sogs pa gdan la bzhag ste 'gro'o //
translated: She will sit on a bundle of kuśa grass, adorned with divine ornaments, and depart.

analyzed: bud med dang 'grogs pa dor bar bya ste; gzhan du na rnam par 'joms par byed do //

analyzed: de nas ka na ka ma ti'i sgrub thabs yin te /

analyzed: shing ba da'i rtsa bar song nas nya dang sha'i gtor ma cho gas dbul bar bya'o //
translated: One should go to the root of a banyan tree and offer a bali of fish and meat.

original: bdag nyid kyang 'thungs te lhag mas mchod yon sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang 'thungs te lhag mas mchod yon sbyin par bya'o //
translated: One should drink it oneself, and give the remainder as an offering.

original: stong phrag gcig bzla bar bya ste /
analyzed: stong phrag gcig bzla bar bya ste /
translated: One should recite the mantra one thousand times.

original: 'di ltar zhag bdun gyi mtshan mo rang nyid 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'di ltar zhag bdun gyi mtshan mo rang nyid 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, she will come herself during the night of the seventh day.

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i 'khor brgya phrag gsum dang mnyam du 'di rnams mtshan phyed nas nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan pa'i 'khor brgya phrag gsum dang mnyam du 'di rnams mtshan phyed nas nges par 'ong bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Adorned with all ornaments, together with a retinue of three hundred, she will definitely come at midnight.

original: 'ongs pa na 'dod pa byas te chung mar 'gyur ro //

analyzed: phyag g-yas na dam bcas khas len pa 'og tu gzhag par bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub kyi sems khu bas @454a *//

analyzed: sa bon h'um yig las rdzogs pa nyi ma'o; ;sa bon phat yig las rdzogs pa tshangs pa'o //

analyzed: sa bon phat yig las rdzogs pa nor 'dzin ma'o //

analyzed: sa bon sv'a yig las rdzogs pa thags bzang ris so //
